request_pathways.name: Mail to SHS HIM PO Box 2728, Corvallis, OR 97339
SHS HIM Lebanon (525 N. Santiam Hwy., Lebanon)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patients are directed to an MRO Express online portal as the primary request method; a downloadable PDF authorization form (hidden in a collapsed section) can also be submitted by mail, fax, or email.

red_flags: EHI export form lacks the 'no charge' commitment stated on the standard ROI form for patient requests
bright_spots: All forms available in both English and Spanish
Dedicated EHI computer-readable export request form — exceptionally rare
Explicit 'No Charge' for initial patient requests and continuing care on standard form
Six delivery format options including MyChart and email

findability.rationale: Level 3: The MRO portal is reachable from the medical records page, but downloadable PDF forms required browser DevTools to discover inside collapsed accordion sections; a patient who prefers a traditional form faces a non-obvious path.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 3: Digitally-authored PDF with text layer but zero fillable fields; fax and email submission available, so a patient can complete the workflow digitally with workarounds (print, fill, scan, email/fax).

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized 2-page form with numbered sections, matching instruction page, 11 record-type checkboxes, and clear headers; minor issues with legal density in the rights section and Section 7's dual-purpose structure.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 4: Patient access is clearly accommodated with a 'Personal' purpose checkbox, self-delivery options, explicit no-charge policy, and MyChart/email delivery — though the form serves multiple purposes and lacks a dedicated patient-only pathway.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: No notarization, no charge for patient requests, 30-day processing commitment, clear revocation rights, appropriate 42 CFR Part 2 handling; minor ambiguity in EHI export form fee language.

overall.summary: Samaritan Health Services provides an above-average patient records request experience with an online portal, bilingual forms, transparent fee policies, and a rare dedicated EHI export option, held back by non-fillable PDFs and poor discoverability of downloadable forms.
